Options.OPTION[Anarchy.Anarchy.AnarchyMo: Always enable Anarchy with Bulldoze Tool
Options.OPTION_DESCRIPTION[Anarchy.Anarc: With this option enabled the Bulldoze Tool will always have anarchy enabled.
With this option enabled the Chirper will be on fire when Anarchy is active for appropriate tools. Image Credit: Bad Peanut.
With this option enabled a tooltip with â’¶ will be shown when Anarchy is active for appropriate tools.
With this option enabled a icon row with a button for Anarchy, Anarchy options menu, and Anarchy components tool, will show up when using appropriate tools.
Upon confirmation this will reset the general settings for Anarchy mod.
Upon confirmation this will reset the UI settings for Anarchy mod.
Upon confirmation this will reset the keybindings for Anarchy mod.
This will routinely trigger a graphical refresh to props placed with Anarchy that have been culled to prevent accidental culling of props. This affects performance.

This is number of frames between graphical refreshes to props placed with Anarchy to prevent accidental culling. Higher numbers will have better performance, but longer possible time that props may be missing.
If props placed with Anarchy have been accidently culled, you can press this button to bring them back now. This doesn't negatively effect performance.
This allows you to place multiple copies of unique buildings using the normal UI menu with or without Anarchy enabled. The effects of these buildings stack!

With the net tool and Anarchy enabled you can violate the clearance of other networks. Zoning under low bridges can spawn buildings while doing this. This setting gives you some control over the minimum space below a low bridge. It would be better to just remove the zoning.

In the editor, with Anarchy and this option enabled, you can place vegetation and props overlapping or inside the boundaries of other objects and close together. The map may require Anarchy as a dependency. When users draw roads through these objects they will not be overriden. Also allows you to Lock Elevation in the editor.
Options.OPTION[Anarchy.Anarchy.AnarchyMo: Disable Anarchy Toggle While Brushing Objects
Options.OPTION_DESCRIPTION[Anarchy.Anarc: Automatically disables the anarchy toggle while brushing objects such as trees. Toggle reverts back to previous state after you stop brushing objects.

Allows trees, plants, and props to be placed at different vertical elevations with Object Tool or Line Tool. Also shows a button during placement for locking elevation. Keybinds are configurable in the Keybinds tab.
Options.OPTION[Anarchy.Anarchy.AnarchyMo: Reset Elevation When Selecting New Asset
Options.OPTION_DESCRIPTION[Anarchy.Anarc: Automatically resets object Elevation tool option when you change to a new asset selection.
YY_ANARCHY_DESCRIPTION.AnarchyButton: Disables error checks for tools and does not display errors. When applicable, you can place vegetation and props (with DevUI 'Add Object' menu) overlapping or inside the boundaries of other objects and close together.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[PreventOverr: Allows placement of vegetation and props overlapping or inside the boundaries of other objects and close together.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[IncreaseElev: Increases the elevation relative to the placement surface. Customize keybind in options menu.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[DecreaseElev: Decreases the elevation relative to the placement surface. Customize keybind in options menu.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[ElevationSte: Changes the rate in which the elevation changes. Customize keybind in options menu.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[ElevationLoc: Prevents game systems from changing elevation. You can still change position with mods.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[ResetElevati: Resets Elevation to 0. Customize keybind in options menu.
Options.OPTION_DESCRIPTION[Anarchy.Anarc: A keybind to switch the Anarchy toggle on or off.
A keybind to reset the elevation value of objects during placement.
A keybind to change the rate in which the elevation value changes.
A keybind to increase the elevation value of objects during placement.
A keybind to decrease the elevation value of objects during placement.
Version number for the Anarchy mod installed.
With this option enabled and while drawing networks, options for ground, elevated, tunnel, and constant slope will appear when applicable in the tool options panel.
With this option enabled and while drawing networks, options for various network upgrades will appear when applicable in the tool options panel. (i.e. street trees, retaining walls, quays, etc.)
Adds a slider for Elevation Step to tool options panel while drawing networks.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[AnarchyOptio: Opens a panel for controlling which error checks are never disabled, disabled with Anarchy, or always disabled.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[ConstantSlop: Forces newly placed networks to have a constant slope or grade from starting point to end point (A -> B).
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[Ground]: Forces terrain to follow newly placed network. Zoned roads should produce zones under normal circumstances.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[WideMedian]: Applies Wide Sidewalk upgrade to the median to produce a wide concrete median.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[ReplaceUpgra: When toggled, replace tool mode will add or remove network upgrades to match the selected upgrades. If not toggled, replace tool mode will preserve network upgrades, if possible.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[AnarchyCompo: Add or remove elevation lock or anarchy components using a tool with radius or single selection. Returns to previous tool when closed with Escape. Radius is recommended for Anarchy component since you can see overridden objects and interact with them. Single selection cannot select overriden objects and they are not visible.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[SingleSelect: Left Mouse Button to add selected component(s). Right Mouse Button to remove selected component(s). Single selection cannot select overriden objects and they are not visible.
Anarchy.TOOLTIP_DESCRIPTION[RadiusSelect: Left Mouse Button to add selected component(s) within radius. Right Mouse Button to remove selected component(s) within radius. Radius is recommended for Anarchy component since you can see overridden objects and interact with them.
Assets.DESCRIPTION[Quay01]: Network raised above terrain with one or two walls along one or both sides. Can be applied to left or right side of applicable networks.
Assets.DESCRIPTION[RetainingWall01]: Network lowered below terrain with one or two walls along one or both sides. Can be applied to left or right side of applicable networks.
Assets.DESCRIPTION[Elevated01]: Forces a network to utilize the elevated mode (i.e. bridge, overpass, crossover).
Assets.DESCRIPTION[Tunnel01]: Forces a network to become a tunnel. Visual perfection is not guaranteed.
